page.title: 06MINCINGFIELD FARM-LAND USE
page.content: {MINCINGFIELD FARM, DURLEY (G.R. SU {527165) Owner: Mr. E. Bastian This farm is run in conjunction with a second farm owned by the Bastian family, but outside this study area: Berrywood Farm at West End (G.R. SU 487152) The description here therefore explains how both farms are managed. The whole complex totals about 800 acres, only 50 of which are at Mincinfield. The bulk of the land is dedicated to permanent pasture. Maize, hay and grass for silage are the main crops of the farms, all geared towards the fattening of cattle. However there are about 200 ewes kept on the farms because they help to keep the paddocks tidy and improve the pasture. Cattle are allocated on a system of about 1 head per acre, so about 50 are kept at Mincinfield
